title: Legitimate Taunting?
body:
Here are some IN GAME taunts that champions say. These are surely the minimum level of taunting we are allowed to say. I seek the boundary of what is acceptable.

"Lowly blasphemer! You are in the presence of a god!"
"Are you even trying?"
"Amateur hour."
"Come back when you've collected all the bits of yourself!"
"Only two jokers in a deck, and I got dealt you."
"Smile, child, or I'll shove your jaw into your brain."
"You are mediocrity. My genius will supplant you."


Taunting in all-chat is an effective strategy. It can help you win games. Taunting is a blatant attempt to trigger the opponent to make impudent choices or fear you more than they should. It is a core function in the game that only a handful use, and fewer use effectively. 

Yet what taunts are legitimate? What are the boundaries? Clearly going past them can be even more effective for winning. It is not my intent to find what taunts are most effective, but rather, what taunting is legitimate and effective. _I think these are good examples._

"You do know Sion's passive, don't you? I mean, I'd assume in ranked, a player would know the champion they're playing, but you make me wonder."
"For a Vel'Koz, you're not very good at zoning... Actually, you seem a shame to Vel'Koz players... You should try Yasuo, he's more your style. Brash." 
"I'm embarrassed to be matched against you. I thought I was better than this... This is ranked, isn't it?"
"I've seen Support Nunu do a better job in JG than your JG... Sorry (insert lane opponent), better JG wins!"

What about name-calling?
"Are you guys a couple? Because I'm seeing an ADC with anemic girlfriend support."
"You had to wiki his passive? What a pleeb."
"SCRUB- you thought you could flash into a 1v1 against a fed Morde?"

Well, I'm not sure where the boundaries are. I intend to take use taunts, responsibly, aggressively, and legitimately. Like Dunkmaster {{champion:122}} .

replies.body:
All of your proposed taunts are verbose ways to actively insult others. As a result, that's not acceptable.

Some things that are acceptable, in moderation, from my own experience:

1. Come top again, Lee Sin. I could use another kill.
2. (Playing Cho'Gath) Season yourself before you come back, please! The flavor is getting predictable. Maybe a little spice this time?
3. (Lux misses an ultimate) Ooh. Nice ult.  You showed those minions who's boss!

These are provoking without being insulting: at worst they trumpet my success and poke at momentary enemy failures, at best they're amusing and lighthearted banter. At no point are they insulting or abusive, provided they are used in moderation.

{{champion:201}} "If at first you do not succeed, please, tell me what it is like."
Well, I'll be. In other words, taunt like ~~baby ram~~ Braum would. It seems the general consensus was going along the right lines, but folks were afraid to imply that going beyond a rudimentary level is acceptable. These examples are good, wish they were easier to find. So hey, where's the mark as answer button...

Literally all of your examples of "taunts" are against the rules. They're disrespectful, insulting, and overall toxic verbal attacks.

Here's an example of legitimate taunting within the bounds of the rules from one of my recent matches;

I was playing Jinx, attempting to recall at low health, and the enemy Jungler started chasing me. I managed to get down into the safety of my turrets and my Support helped me kill the Jungler, and I typed in /all chat "No. >:c"

When I finished my recall, I fired my ult down middle lane because I saw our Jungler was about to kill the enemy ADC, and my ult landed and scored the killing blow, so I added into /all chat; "And a boom-de-yada for good measure."

_That_ is the kind of taunting that's allowed. It's curt, a little bit rude, but it's not straight-up insulting anyone's intelligence or skill - it's celebrating my own.

"No" with an angry-sad face isn't taunting. "Bo-Ya" is not a taunt. In no way does it 
noun
noun: taunt; plural noun: taunts

    1.
    a remark made in order to anger, wound, or provoke someone.

Ctrl-2 is a taunt. Darius has some good ones. "Dat Fail." when seeing Ashe.

Get Real. What is a REAL taunt that is within the bounds?

> "No" with an angry~~-sad~~ face isn't taunting. "Bo-Ya" is not a taunt. In no way does it
> noun
> noun: taunt; plural noun: taunts
> 
> 1.
> a remark made in order to anger, wound, or provoke someone.

How is it _not_ a taunt? The "No" very clearly was meant to wound the enemy Jungler after their failed attempt to kill me on backing. The "Boom-de-yada" was an added boast for extra salt in the wound. I was telling them, plain and simple; "You failed, now watch me style on your teammates".

> Ctrl-2 is a taunt. Darius has some good ones. "Dat Fail." when seeing Ashe.

Well, then just fall back on CTRL+2. If you like hearing Champion Taunt quotes, do that.

> Get Real.

If the only form of taunting you see as legitimate is toxicity and insults, then I'll tell you flat-out; _Don't bother taunting unless you want to get sacked with a penalty._ 'Cause like I said, all of the examples in your OP are against the rules.

> What is a REAL taunt that is within the bounds?

I just gave you an example. Non-insulting jibes that err more on celebrating your own skill than bashing and belittling the other players. And, like I said, if you only consider insults and toxicity as valid taunting, then don't taunt at all.
I think Djinn hit it on the head. You are right, I was simply dissatisfied with straightforward boasting.

Is any taunting in chat really legitimate. Most of the time it just makes the other person look like a child and just results in them being muted and talking to themselves... and if someone takes the bait of someone talking shit in chat instead of ignoring it they were probably going to lose that fight anyway. Anyone who can't play this without getting triggered at the smallest thing is not going to do well.

That is the literal point of taunts, to provoke them or make them fear you. It is a core part of the game that can't be ignored with a feature. Yes, my examples ARE intended to poke them where it hurts. Kindergarten approved boasts won't provoke anyone. Any real sport includes barbed comments. Now, how about we all stop being afraid of stepping on someone's feelings and think of something that actually counts as a legit taunt?

>"Any real sport includes barbed comments."

Yeah but people still get benched or kicked for unsportsmanlike conduct.
That's the thing. 
Even when bantering there's a mutual expectancy to not cross certain lines and to still behave like a civil adult human being. 
And by the standards set by Riot, your examples are all generally toxic and unacceptable.
Taunting by nature is mean spirited for the most part but there are better ways to do it, because if you say things like this in game you'll eventually get banned--- and you'll 100% deserve it.
Riot makes it pretty clear what is and is not acceptable.

If you really want to try and tilt out your opponent without breaking rules you can just leave a "?" in chat whenever you solo kill someone.
Just don't be surprised if they return the favor if they kill you.

Let me expand. Champions, whom can't be muted unless you crank down the volume, say the likes of

"Lowly blasphemer! You are in the presence of a god!"
"Are you even trying?"
"Amateur hour."
"Come back when you've collected all the bits of yourself!"
"Only two jokers in a deck, and I got dealt you."
"Smile, child, or I'll shove your jaw into your brain."
"You are mediocrity. My genius will supplant you."

Those MUST be the bare minimum of what taunts we can say in all chat. Not this preschool tee-hee boasts ya'll are suggesting.

I'm not suggesting it out of personal opinion that we should be so limited, but because going any further will get you in trouble.
I do think Riot can be a bit harsh in limiting banter, but I also think the examples in your original post go a bit far for banter, especially the bit that was borderline sexist (which is really fuckin' uncool).

If you like the champion taunts so much you can sit and spam a good number of them without needing to type in chat at all.

As far as the provided examples, you could probably go a bit further, but again, at your own risk. 
Personally I think intentionally tilting opponents with remarks in chat is a sleazy underhanded tactic people use as a crutch for a lack of actual skill, but I accept that mental warfare is also a big thing in games and sports.

Just maybe find other ways to tilt people if that's really the route you'd like to go. Like repeatedly catching and killing the enemy jungle at their camps, or roaming to the same lane over and over. 

Typing long lines like what you suggested might not only tilt the enemy but your own team.
Having a player on your team repeatedly stop to type a novel flaming the enemy team in all chat is pretty annoying.
Some food for thought.

Thanks, that's the sort of insightful comments I've been seeking. As you can tell, I'm not averse to ruffling feathers. Chat is indeed part of it. Just last game I played used such level of mental warfare- a couple minutes after losing a team fight, the enemy...

{{champion:222}} "Ugh, please just mid and end this... My team are a bunch of asses."

She goes and sits in mid ahead of her team, pretty far out, and says that. She baited herself. Zac flies in and you can guess the rest. It would be shocking if she got banned for that. Angering, even.

Of course I'm not looking to find the line by testing the waters. Those last examples (such as the sexist one) I haven't used in game, I know not to go _that_ far. Yet surely the banning team wouldn't ban the very banter the in game champions use, that's inane. Some of the one-liners have enough kick to them to satisfy me, but not limited to one champion, especially the nice ones (haha).

I hope someone can actually nail down what is and isn't good, as the ToS aren't clear as they seem to suggest their champions' banter are against the code of conduct.

Alright I'll give it to the Jinx in your example, if that was planned out with her team, that's pretty hilarious and I doubt anyone would report her for that.
If she actually had the intention of running it down, and her team just made the best of a bad situation, she would be getting a report from me for sure. 


And yeah, testing the waters with Riot is a dangerous game.
If you really aren't sure, general rule of thumb-- ***If it's racist, sexist, homophobic, or a personal attack, it's a big no-no***.

So basically instead of, "Ha! have you ever even played Nidalee before? I can't believe you missed that spear, you should play something else, noob."
Say something like, "Nice Q." or "You should probably aim AT me" (though the latter may be a bit risky, still)

Simple yet effective. Not super wordy and gets your point across. 
I still don't really condone the 'toxic to victory' mentality.
If you really want out of silver just learn how to farm, tbh. It's literally that easy, no need to jump through all these mental hoops.

Now we're talking! "Nice Q." is much better than "?". I believe the big question now rests on, _what counts as a personal attack?_

"Aim at me next time?" - I'm not seeing how this is violating. Yeah, its offensive, and it certainly is a personally targeted attack. But it doesn't attack them as people- its nothing like "Missing your eyeglasses, man? C'MON AIM!"

Yeah, shamefully silver, my greatest weakness is bad map awareness. Yet I want to use taunts not just because it can give an advantage, but also because it is a form of interaction.

No, those are not anything other than the character's in-game taunts. They aren't guidelines for what is appropriate for us players to use. If you wish to use those taunts, use that champion and use the appropriate keyboard shortcut for the taunt. Write it to chat yourself, and you risk being punished. Simple.

I'll surely admit my examples were pretty harsh. Are ya'll really saying the likes of...

"Nope >:P"
"?"
"lol"
"gotcha ;)"

...are my limits? That's ridiculous.

It sounds to me that you are saying that you don't have the skills to win a fair fight. I don't have much skills either, but I rather spend my time to actually play the game, instead of typing. I even have more of an advantage against people like you; while you your write taunts in all chat, I click, attack, move... and once you press enter, I don't see a thing in all chat, because that thing is turned off. :D

Anyways; Taunts are a weak person's weapon and they risk your account getting punished. It is your choice if you wish to be labeled weak and risk your account doing so.

i miss xayahs pbe line when the first minion wave arrived...
"great, more little shits"

I would avoid every example you give. Stick to built in taunts that the game gives you. Or if you must, dont include ANY personal insults. Calling people plebs and scrubs, implying the jungler is the reason for their loss, or talking about how bad at zoning they are, could open you up to getting your account punished. If anything, stick to super light things like "ohhh better luck next time actually hitting your skillshots ;)" or "you thought you could kill me? Hah!" ...stupid corny shit I would never say. I just stick to emotes at opportune times. (Im just saying this as a "better safe than sorry" sort of thing. Riot is super strict about verbal toxicity)
